docs.title: index
docs.text: Scope: Docs entry point. Audience: Readers starting here. Guarantees: Points to the spine and scope. Non-Goals: Deep technical detail. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Agentic Proteins is a deterministic, artifact-first protein design runtime and CLI. Architecture components are defined in architecture/architecture.md. Read meta/DOCS_STYLE.md before edits. Read meta/SPINE.md for order.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Deterministic runs occur for identical inputs and seeds. CLI JSON output schema is stable across releases. Run artifacts follow a stable layout.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Install with pipx install agentic-proteins. Run with agentic-proteins run --sequence "ACDEFGHIKLMNPQRSTVWY". Inspect with agentic-proteins inspect-candidate <candidate_id>.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Docs: index.md. Docs spine: meta/SPINE.md. Getting started: overview/getting_started.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: API doc: api/overview.md. Core concepts: concepts/core_concepts.md. Docs style: meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This entrypoint becomes obsolete when a generated index replaces it. The replacement is meta/SPINE.md. Obsolete copies are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: abstraction_removal
docs.text: Scope: Removal of unused abstraction layers. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Removed layers are documented and tested. Non-Goals: Historical narrative. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc records the abstraction removal. Architecture components are defined in architecture.md. Read ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md for structure.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: The contracts interface layer was removed. The registry base class was removed. The registry re-export indirection was removed.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Direct imports replace removed layers. Registry behavior remains explicit. Public interfaces remain tested.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing imports fail tests. Unexpected coupling fails review. Undefined layers are rejected.

docs.title: Extension Points

docs.title: architecture
docs.text: Scope: Architecture single source of truth. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Diagram and narrative are canonical. Non-Goals: Alternative diagrams or component redefinitions. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Architecture components are defined here and referenced elsewhere. Read ../../concepts/core_concepts.md for vocabulary. Read ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md for structure.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: The diagram below is the single source of truth. The narrative below defines component roles. Other docs reference this page for components. Diagram: CLI -> runtime control <- API -> providers -> artifacts -> evaluation artifact. CLI and API submit requests to runtime control, which coordinates providers and writes artifacts.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Runtime control records each execution unit. Providers are isolated from runtime control state. Artifacts are immutable after write.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Component drift creates inconsistent behavior. Missing references cause documentation mismatch. Broken links invalidate the diagram contract.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Architecture changes update invariants.md. Architecture changes update execution_model.md. Architecture changes update execution_lifecycle.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when architecture is generated. The replacement is invariants.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/integration/test_runtime_flow.py.

docs.title: conservation
docs.text: Scope: Global conservation checks. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Conservation violations stop execution. Non-Goals: Biological realism beyond constraints. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines pathway-level conservation checks. Architecture components are defined in architecture.md. Read ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md for structure.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Total energy is bounded by a minimum. Activation mass is capped per pathway. Resource dependencies are validated against a pool.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Violations are detected and logged. Execution stops on violation. Checks apply to every tick.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Energy violations raise errors. Activation mass violations raise errors. Resource violations raise errors.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Conservation changes update metrics.md. Contract changes update pathway_limits.md. Documentation updates follow ../../meta/TRIAGE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when checks are generated. The replacement is architecture.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/biology/pathway.py.

docs.title: execution_cost
docs.text: Scope: Canonical execution cost per tick. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Cost fields are defined and recorded. Non-Goals: Benchmark optimization. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines canonical execution cost. Architecture components are defined in architecture.md. Read ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md for structure.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: CPU time is recorded per tick. Memory usage is recorded per tick. Agent count and signal volume are recorded per tick.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Cost records are appended per step. Cost fields are numeric and non-negative. Cost recording does not mutate state.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing cost records fail tests. Negative values fail validation. Inconsistent ticks fail review.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Cost changes update metrics.md. Stress tests update pathway_limits.md. Documentation updates follow ../../meta/TRIAGE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when costs are generated. The replacement is metrics.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/biology/pathway.py.

docs.title: execution_lifecycle
docs.text: Scope: Execution lifecycle state machine. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: States and transitions are explicit. Non-Goals: Alternate lifecycles. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines the execution lifecycle state machine. Read architecture.md for component context. Read ../../concepts/core_concepts.md for vocabulary.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: States and transitions are listed below. The lifecycle uses a single linear progression. Deviations are failures. - init -> plan - plan -> act - act -> observe - observe -> evaluate - evaluate -> terminate - terminate -> terminate

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: State order is init, plan, act, observe, evaluate, terminate. Each execution unit records its state. Transitions align with execution_model.md.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Out-of-order transitions break traceability. Missing states break evaluation artifact records. Lifecycle drift breaks architecture.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Lifecycle changes update execution_model.md. Lifecycle changes update invariants.md. Lifecycle changes update ../../concepts/core_concepts.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when execution is generated. The replacement is architecture.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/integration/test_runtime_flow.py.

docs.title: execution_model
docs.text: Scope: Deterministic versus agentic boundary. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Boundaries are explicit and testable. Non-Goals: Provider-specific behavior. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines deterministic and agentic boundaries. Read architecture.md for component context. Read ../../concepts/core_concepts.md for vocabulary.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Deterministic behavior covers state transitions and artifact hashing. The execution contract is recorded in src/agentic_proteins/core/contracts.py. Agentic behavior is limited to provider outputs and selection.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Deterministic paths use fixed inputs and seeds. Agentic paths record every decision and output. Boundaries align with invariants.md.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Untracked stochastic output breaks reproducibility. Missing logs break traceability. Boundary drift breaks architecture.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Boundary changes update execution_lifecycle.md. Boundary changes update invariants.md. Boundary changes update ../../concepts/core_concepts.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when execution is generated. The replacement is architecture.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: llm_authority
docs.text: Scope: LLM authority boundary. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: LLM actions are bounded and enforced. Non-Goals: Model benchmarking. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines the LLM authority boundary. Architecture components are defined in architecture.md. Read ../../concepts/core_concepts.md for vocabulary. Read ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md for structure.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Allowed actions are tuning only. Forbidden actions include any state mutation. Read-only and write-through permissions are explicit.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Proposals never mutate state directly. Validation rejects invalid proposals. Approvals gate all proposal application.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Forbidden actions raise errors. Invalid proposals are rejected and logged. Missing approvals block proposal application.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Authority changes update ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Authority changes update ../../concepts/core_concepts.md. Authority changes update architecture.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when authority is generated. The replacement is architecture.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/biology/regulator.py.

docs.title: metrics
docs.text: Scope: Minimal metrics set. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Metrics are defined and computed. Non-Goals: Comprehensive analytics. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines the minimal metrics set. Architecture components are defined in architecture.md. Read execution_cost.md for cost context.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Pathway throughput is reported. Failure rate is reported. Recovery success is reported. Signal entropy is reported. LLM intervention delta is reported.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Metrics are computed from event logs. Metrics never mutate pathway state. Metrics are deterministic for fixed logs.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing metrics fail tests. Undefined metrics are rejected. Non-deterministic metrics are rejected.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Metric changes update execution_cost.md. Stress tests update pathway_limits.md. Documentation updates follow ../../meta/TRIAGE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when metrics are generated. The replacement is execution_cost.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/biology/pathway.py.

docs.title: negative_results
docs.text: Scope: Negative results criteria. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Failure scenarios are explicit and tested. Non-Goals: Success narratives. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines negative results scenarios. Architecture components are defined in architecture.md. Read metrics.md for measurement context.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: A cyclic pathway must fail validation. A proposal that increases energy cost must worsen stability. Degraded proteins must not recover.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Negative results are enforced by tests. Failures are structured and observable. No hidden recovery is allowed.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Silent success invalidates results. Missing failures invalidate tests. Undefined scenarios are rejected.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Scenario changes update metrics.md. Contract changes update pathway_limits.md. Documentation updates follow ../../meta/TRIAGE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when results are generated. The replacement is metrics.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: pathway_limits
docs.text: Scope: Hard limits for agent interactions. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Limits are enforced at runtime. Non-Goals: Adaptive scaling. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines pathway interaction limits. Architecture components are defined in architecture.md. Read ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md for structure.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Incoming signals per tick are capped. Outgoing signals per tick are capped. Dependency depth is capped.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Limits apply to every pathway. Limit violations stop execution. Limits are recorded in tests.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Limit violations raise errors. Silent overflow is rejected. Cycles are blocked by contract rules.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Limit changes update execution_cost.md. Contract changes update architecture.md. Documentation updates follow ../../meta/TRIAGE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when limits are generated. The replacement is architecture.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/biology/pathway.py.

docs.title: core_concepts
docs.text: Scope: Closed vocabulary for core concepts. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Definitions are canonical and enforced. Non-Goals: Expanded domain theory. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Core concepts are defined as a closed vocabulary. Read ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md before edits. Architecture components are defined in architecture/architecture.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Definitions below are the only canonical wording. All docs reference this page for vocabulary. Terms are linked when used. - agent: An agent is a stateful decision unit that selects a tool and emits actions. - tool: A tool is a callable capability used by an agent within an execution unit. - policy: A policy is a constraint set that governs agent decisions and tool usage. - execution unit: An execution unit is a bounded step that applies a tool and records outputs. - evaluation artifact: An evaluation artifact is a stored result from scoring or validation. - protein: A protein is a constrained agent with explicit state and constraints. - signal: A signal is a typed input that triggers a state transition. - pathway: A pathway is a multi-agent system of protein agents. - regulation: Regulation is bounded proposal tuning that never mutates state. - cell: A cell is an execution environment for pathways.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Canonical wording is enforced in ../meta/NAMING.md. Aliases are not used in docs. Vocabulary aligns with ../overview/getting_started.md. failure semantics align with architecture/invariants.md.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Alias usage fails docs lint. Unlinked terms fail docs lint. Redefinition outside this page fails review. recovery semantics align with architecture/invariants.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Change requests follow ../meta/TRIAGE.md. Updates propagate to ../overview/getting_started.md. Updates propagate to architecture/architecture.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when vocabulary is generated. The replacement is architecture/architecture.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Contracts

docs.title: Invariants

docs.title: Failure Modes

docs.title: Overview

docs.title: Contracts

docs.title: Invariants

docs.title: mpi
docs.text: Scope: Minimal public interface (MPI). Audience: External users and contributors. Guarantees: Entry points and contracts are fixed. Non-Goals: Full API inventory. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc lists the MPI entry points. MPI scope aligns with ../governance/core.md. Usage context lives in golden_path.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Entry point: CLI. Input is CLI arguments. Output is exit status and workspace artifacts. Entry point: RunManager. Input is a run directory and config. Output is a run result mapping. Entry point: PathwayExecutor.step. Input is a list of SignalPayload. Output is a list of SignalPayload. Entry point: ProteinAgent.apply_signal. Input is a SignalPayload plus ProteinConstraints and ProteinState. Output is a ProteinState. Entry point: SignalPayload. Input is typed fields (source_id, targets, signal_type via SignalType, magnitude). Output is a validated payload instance. Intentionally inaccessible: runtime control, execution runtime, and registry internals.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: MPI size is capped by surface_area.md. MPI meaning aligns with ../concepts/core_concepts.md. MPI changes require architecture/invariants.md.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: MPI expansion breaks surface_area.md. Hidden entry points break ../governance/core.md. Unlinked usage breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extension rules live in architecture/experimental.md. Playground usage is described in sandbox.md. Review rules align with ../meta/TRIAGE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when MPI is generated. The replacement is surface_area.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/core/surface_area.py.

docs.title: sandbox
docs.text: Scope: Sandbox separation. Audience: External users and contributors. Guarantees: Core and sandbox remain distinct. Non-Goals: Sandbox feature catalog. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines the sandbox split. Core context lives in ../governance/core.md. Experimental context lives in architecture/experimental.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Core modules live under src/agentic_proteins/core. Sandbox modules live under src/agentic_proteins/sandbox. Sandbox code is marked experimental.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Core stability aligns with architecture/invariants.md. Sandbox usage aligns with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence aligns with tests/unit/test_module_stability.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Mixing core and sandbox breaks ../governance/core.md. Unlabeled sandbox code breaks architecture/experimental.md. Unlinked usage breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions follow architecture/experimental.md. Review rules align with ../meta/TRIAGE.md. MPI changes align with mpi.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when sandbox is removed. The replacement is architecture/experimental.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/sandbox/init.py.

docs.title: surface_area
docs.text: Scope: Surface-area budgeting. Audience: External users and contributors. Guarantees: Public surface stays bounded. Non-Goals: Full API listing. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines surface-area budgets. MPI context lives in mpi.md. Architecture context lives in architecture/invariants.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Public entry points are capped by src/agentic_proteins/core/surface_area.py. Extension points are capped by the same budget. Configuration knobs are capped by the same budget.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Budgets align with ../governance/core.md. Budget checks align with tests/unit/test_surface_area_budget.py. Budget changes update mpi.md.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Budget overruns trigger review. Untracked entry points break ../governance/core.md. Unlinked usage breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions follow architecture/experimental.md. Review rules align with ../meta/TRIAGE.md. MPI changes align with mpi.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when budgets are generated. The replacement is mpi.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/core/surface_area.py.

docs.title: why_not_x
docs.text: Scope: Why-not-X contrasts. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Contrasts are explicit. Non-Goals: Full survey. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc lists explicit contrasts. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. MPI context lives in mpi.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Workflow engines focus on orchestration, while this system focuses on bounded state transitions. Classic MAS frameworks optimize global coordination, while this system enforces local contracts. End-to-end LLM agents blur control, while this system enforces regulator boundaries.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Contrasts align with ../governance/core.md. Contrasts align with architecture/execution_model.md. Evidence aligns with tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing contrasts weakens reviewability. Contrast drift breaks ../governance/core.md. Unlinked usage breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions follow architecture/experimental.md. Review rules align with ../meta/TRIAGE.md. MPI changes align with surface_area.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when contrasts are encoded. The replacement is ../governance/core.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: anti_patterns
docs.text: Scope: Non-agentic anti-patterns. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Anti-patterns are explicit and rejected. Non-Goals: Exhaustive catalog. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc lists rejected patterns. Anti-patterns align with core.md. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Direct state mutation bypasses src/agentic_proteins/biology/protein_agent.py. Hidden stochastic paths violate architecture/invariants.md. Undeclared transitions violate src/agentic_proteins/biology/validation.py.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Agent behavior stays within ../concepts/core_concepts.md. Transition rules align with architecture/execution_model.md. Checks align with tests/unit/test_protein_agent.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Bypass attempts break architecture/invariants.md. Silent changes break core.md. Drift detection aligns with tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions follow architecture/experimental.md. Extension checks align with tests/unit/test_module_stability.py. Extension docs align with ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when anti-patterns are encoded. The replacement is architecture/invariants.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/biology/protein_agent.py.

docs.title: core
docs.text: Scope: Non-negotiable core definition. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Core meaning does not drift. Non-Goals: Feature rationale. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines the immutable core. Core terms align with ../concepts/core_concepts.md. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Core meaning binds agent, pathway, and cell roles. Contract locks live in architecture/invariants.md. Evidence uses tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Core meaning stays fixed across releases. Core meaning aligns with architecture/invariants.md. Evidence aligns with tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Core drift breaks architecture/invariants.md. Untracked changes break ../concepts/core_concepts.md. Missing evidence breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions follow architecture/experimental.md. Extension rules align with ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when the core is encoded. The replacement is architecture/architecture.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: positioning
docs.text: Scope: Final positioning choice. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Position is explicit. Non-Goals: Market analysis. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines the final positioning. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. Vocabulary aligns with ../concepts/core_concepts.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Positioning is agent systems research. Computational biology context is modeled, not claimed as primary. Hybrid simulation framing is limited to pathway execution. Evidence uses tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Positioning stays fixed across releases. Positioning aligns with core.md. Evidence aligns with tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Ambiguous positioning weakens reviewability. Position drift breaks core.md. Missing evidence breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Position updates follow ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when positioning is encoded. The replacement is core.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: release_identity
docs.text: Scope: Release identity selection. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Identity is explicit. Non-Goals: Marketing framing. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines the release identity. Positioning context lives in positioning.md. Version context lives in semver.md.

docs.title: Contracts

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Identity stays fixed across releases. Identity aligns with positioning.md. Identity aligns with semver.md.

docs.title: Failure Modes

docs.title: Extension Points

docs.title: Exit Criteria

This doc is obsolete when identity is encoded. The replacement is core.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

docs.title: roadmap_ceiling
docs.text: Scope: Research roadmap ceiling. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Out-of-scope areas are explicit. Non-Goals: Feature backlog. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc states explicit research ceilings. Ceilings align with core.md. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: The system avoids unsupervised topology mutation. The system avoids hidden state mutation in src/agentic_proteins/biology/protein_agent.py. The system avoids replacing contract locks in src/agentic_proteins/core/api_lock.py.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Ceilings align with architecture/invariants.md. Ceilings align with architecture/experimental.md. Checks align with tests/unit/test_core_api_lock.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Scope drift breaks core.md. Implicit expansion breaks architecture/invariants.md. Untracked changes break ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions follow architecture/experimental.md. Extension docs align with ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extension checks align with tests/unit/test_module_stability.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when scope is encoded. The replacement is core.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/core/api_lock.py.

docs.title: semver
docs.text: Scope: Semantic version meaning. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Version semantics are explicit. Non-Goals: Release tooling. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines semantic version meaning. Version meaning aligns with core.md. Release history is tracked in ../CHANGELOG.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: MAJOR means semantic model change. MINOR means new capability without meaning shift. PATCH means bug fix only.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Version changes align with architecture/invariants.md. Contract locks align with src/agentic_proteins/core/api_lock.py. Checks align with tests/unit/test_core_api_lock.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Meaning drift breaks core.md. Mismatched versions break ../CHANGELOG.md. Untracked changes break architecture/invariants.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions follow architecture/experimental.md. Extension checks align with tests/unit/test_module_stability.py. Extension docs align with ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when versioning is generated. The replacement is ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: src/agentic_proteins/core/api_lock.py.

docs.title: cli_surface
docs.text: Scope: CLI surface list. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Surface list matches click definitions. Non-Goals: Usage examples. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines one responsibility. Architecture components are defined in ../architecture/architecture.md. Read ../cli/cli.md before edits. Read ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md for context.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Each statement is a contract. Contracts align with tests/unit/test_cli_surface_documentation.py. Contracts link to ../cli/cli.md and ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. - api - api serve - compare - export-report - inspect-candidate - reproduce - resume - run - --artifacts-dir - --dry-run - --execution-mode - --fasta - --host - --json - --no-docs - --no-logs - --output - --port - --pretty - --provider - --reload - --rounds - --sequence

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Invariants describe stable behavior. Checks align with tests/unit/test_cli_surface_documentation.py. Invariants align with ../cli/cli.md.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Failures are explicit and tested. Failure coverage aligns with tests/unit/test_cli_surface_documentation.py. Failures align with ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions require tests and docs. Extensions are tracked in ../cli/cli.md. Extensions align with tests/unit/test_cli_surface_documentation.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when the surface ends. The replacement is linked in ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_cli_surface_documentation.py.

docs.title: DOCS_STYLE
docs.text: Scope: Documentation style contract for docs/. Audience: Contributors editing docs. Guarantees: Docs follow a single structure and voice. Non-Goals: Narrative guidance, marketing, or philosophy. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines the documentation structure. Architecture components are defined in architecture/architecture.md. Read DOCS_VOICE.md for voice rules. Read TRIAGE.md for lifecycle rules.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Section order is Overview, Contracts, Invariants, Failure Modes, Extension Points, Exit Criteria. Allowed section names match the order list. Max section depth is H2.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Each doc has the front-matter block. Each section has three sentences or a table. Each doc links to two docs and one code artifact.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Style violations fail docs lint. Style violations block CI. Style violations require a rewrite.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Style changes occur in this file. Style changes update scripts/check_docs_consistency.py. Style changes update DOCS_VOICE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when docs are generated. The replacement is scripts/check_docs_consistency.py. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: scripts/check_docs_consistency.py.

docs.title: DOCS_VOICE
docs.text: Scope: Documentation voice rules. Audience: Contributors writing docs. Guarantees: Voice rules are enforced by CI. Non-Goals: Copywriting advice. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines the documentation voice. Architecture components are defined in architecture/architecture.md. Read DOCS_STYLE.md before edits. Read NAMING.md for naming context.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Tense is present and declarative. Person is impersonal and system-centric. Sentence length is limited to twenty words.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Marketing language is forbidden. Opinion and hedging language is forbidden. Narrative framing is forbidden.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Voice violations fail docs lint. Voice violations block CI. Voice violations require a rewrite.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Voice rules change only in this file. Voice changes update scripts/check_docs_consistency.py. Voice changes update DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when docs are generated. The replacement is scripts/check_docs_consistency.py. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: scripts/check_docs_consistency.py.

docs.title: NAMING
docs.text: Scope: Canonical naming registry. Audience: Contributors and reviewers. Guarantees: Names and casing are enforced. Non-Goals: Domain theory. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines canonical names. Architecture components are defined in architecture/architecture.md. Read DOCS_STYLE.md before edits. Read DOCS_VOICE.md for voice rules.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Canonical names are listed below. Forbidden aliases are listed below. Capitalization follows the canonical list.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Each concept has one canonical name. Aliases are rejected in docs. Casing is enforced by CI.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Alias usage fails docs lint. Casing drift fails docs lint. Undefined names fail reviews.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Naming changes occur in this file. Naming changes update scripts/check_docs_consistency.py. Naming changes update TRIAGE.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when naming is generated. The replacement is scripts/check_docs_consistency.py. Obsolete docs are removed.

Canonical names: - CLI - API - run_id - artifacts - agent - tool - policy - execution unit - evaluation artifact - protein - signal - pathway - regulation - cell

Forbidden aliases: - command line - endpoint - run id - artifact directory - execution-unit - evaluation output

Code refs: scripts/check_docs_consistency.py.

docs.title: SPINE
docs.text: Scope: Single navigation spine for docs/. Audience: Readers consuming docs top-down. Guarantees: Lists all docs in order. Non-Goals: Per-topic READMEs. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines one responsibility. Architecture components are defined in ../architecture/architecture.md. Read ../index.md before edits. Read DOCS_STYLE.md for context.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Each statement is a contract. Contracts align with mkdocs.yml. Contracts link to ../index.md and DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Invariants describe stable behavior. Checks align with mkdocs.yml. Invariants align with ../index.md.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Failures are explicit and tested. Failure coverage aligns with mkdocs.yml. Failures align with DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions require tests and docs. Extensions are tracked in ../index.md. Extensions align with mkdocs.yml.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when the surface ends. The replacement is linked in DOCS_STYLE.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py. Docs list: - meta/DOCS_STYLE.md - meta/DOCS_VOICE.md - meta/NAMING.md - meta/TRIAGE.md - meta/SPINE.md - index.md - overview/getting_started.md - concepts/core_concepts.md - governance/core.md - governance/semver.md - governance/anti_patterns.md - governance/roadmap_ceiling.md - governance/positioning.md - governance/release_identity.md - research/agentic_criteria.md - research/agent_taxonomy.md - research/formal_model.md - research/falsifiable_claim.md - research/decisive_experiment.md - research/ablation_studies.md - research/neutral_results.md - research/reviewer_premortem.md - research/system_schematic.md - externalization/mpi.md - externalization/golden_path.md - externalization/misuse_guards.md - externalization/surface_area.md - externalization/sandbox.md - externalization/invariant_visualization.md - externalization/why_not_x.md - architecture/architecture.md - architecture/invariants.md - architecture/experimental.md - architecture/llm_authority.md - architecture/execution_model.md - architecture/execution_lifecycle.md - architecture/design_debt.md - cli/cli.md - interface/cli_surface.md - api/overview.md - api/schema.md - security/dependencies.md - security/threat_model.md - security/citation.md

docs.title: TRIAGE
docs.text: Scope: Triage rules for documentation lifecycle. Audience: Contributors deciding doc changes. Guarantees: Docs exist only when tied to code. Non-Goals: Content authoring guidance. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines one responsibility. Architecture components are defined in architecture/architecture.md. Read DOCS_STYLE.md before edits. Read SPINE.md for context.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Each statement is a contract. Contracts align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py. Contracts link to DOCS_STYLE.md and SPINE.md.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Invariants describe stable behavior. Checks align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py. Invariants align with DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Failures are explicit and tested. Failure coverage aligns with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py. Failures align with SPINE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions require tests and docs. Extensions are tracked in DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when the surface ends. The replacement is linked in SPINE.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: getting_started
docs.text: Scope: Single install and run path. Audience: Users running the CLI. Guarantees: One reproducible path with fixed assumptions. Non-Goals: Alternative setups or options. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Getting started defines one install and run path. Read ../concepts/core_concepts.md for vocabulary. Read dependencies.md for dependency constraints. Architecture components are defined in architecture/architecture.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Install with pipx install agentic-proteins. Run with agentic-proteins run --sequence "ACDEFGHIKLMNPQRSTVWY". Artifacts are stored under artifacts/<run_id>/.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Local filesystem permissions prevent cross-tenant access. Providers return deterministic results for fixed inputs. CI artifacts are not tampered with between steps.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing allowlist dependencies in dependencies.md break this path. Assumptions are tracked in threat_model.md. Invalid sequences fail validation.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Changes update cli/cli.md. Dependency changes update dependencies.md. Vocabulary changes update ../concepts/core_concepts.md.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when a generated entrypoint replaces it. The replacement is index.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/integration/test_cli.py.

docs.title: ablation_studies
docs.text: Scope: Ablation study matrix. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Ablations are explicit. Non-Goals: Full experiment suite. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc lists required ablations. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. Claim context lives in falsifiable_claim.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Each ablation removes one capability. Ablations compare recovery and failure metrics. Metrics follow architecture/metrics.md. Evidence uses tests/regression/test_negative_results.py. | Ablation | Removed capability | Expected signal. | | --- | --- | --- | | No regulator | Proposal application | Recovery drop. | | No stochasticity | Noise in transitions | Variance drop. | | No recovery | Failure handling | Recovery drop. | | No constraints | Constraint checks | Failure rise. |

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Ablation list stays fixed. List aligns with ../governance/core.md. Evidence aligns with tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing ablations weaken claims. List drift breaks ../governance/core.md. Missing evidence breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Ablation updates follow ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when ablations are encoded. The replacement is architecture/metrics.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: agent_taxonomy
docs.text: Scope: Mapping to agent taxonomies. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Contrasts are explicit. Non-Goals: Exhaustive survey. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc maps the system to known taxonomies. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. Vocabulary aligns with ../concepts/core_concepts.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: BDI agents use belief, desire, intention loops. This system uses fixed transition rules instead of deliberation. Reactive agents use direct stimulus-response rules. This system adds constraints and failure states beyond direct reactions. MDP agents assume global policy optimization. This system uses local transition validation without global policy search. Multi-agent systems focus on interaction graphs. This system uses explicit signal scopes and pathway contracts.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Taxonomy mapping stays consistent. Mapping aligns with architecture/invariants.md. Evidence aligns with tests/unit/test_protein_system_rigidity.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Unstated contrasts weaken reviewability. Drift in mapping breaks ../governance/core.md. Unlinked references break ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Mapping updates follow ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when mapping is encoded. The replacement is architecture/architecture.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_protein_system_rigidity.py.

docs.title: agentic_criteria
docs.text: Scope: Agentic criteria checklist. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Checklist entries map to evidence. Non-Goals: Marketing claims. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines a checklist for agentic criteria. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. Vocabulary aligns with ../concepts/core_concepts.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Checklist entries are fixed. Each entry maps to a test or artifact. Evidence is linked below. - Statefulness is verified in tests/unit/test_protein_agent.py. - Autonomy bounds align with architecture/llm_authority.md. - Decision locality aligns with architecture/execution_model.md. - Failure and recovery align with architecture/invariants.md. - Non-orchestration aligns with architecture/execution_lifecycle.md.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Criteria remain consistent across releases. Criteria align with ../governance/core.md. Criteria checks align with tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing evidence breaks this checklist. Drift in criteria breaks ../governance/core.md. Unlinked evidence breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Criteria updates follow ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when criteria are encoded. The replacement is architecture/invariants.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_protein_agent.py.

docs.title: decisive_experiment
docs.text: Scope: Decisive experiment design. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Experiment is interpretable. Non-Goals: Full protocol. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines one decisive experiment. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. Claim context lives in falsifiable_claim.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Experiment compares recovery rate with and without regulator proposals. Metrics follow architecture/metrics.md. The experiment uses deterministic replay from architecture/execution_model.md. Evidence uses tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Experiment inputs remain fixed. Experiment aligns with ../governance/core.md. Evidence aligns with tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing controls breaks interpretation. Drift in setup breaks falsifiable_claim.md. Missing evidence breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Experiment updates follow ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when an experiment suite exists. The replacement is architecture/metrics.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: falsifiable_claim
docs.text: Scope: Single falsifiable claim. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Claim is testable. Non-Goals: Multiple hypotheses. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc states one falsifiable claim. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. Vocabulary aligns with ../concepts/core_concepts.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Claim: bounded regulator proposals improve recovery rate without raising failure rate. Recovery rate is computed in architecture/metrics.md. Failure rate is computed in architecture/metrics.md. Evidence uses tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Claim wording stays fixed. Claim aligns with ../governance/core.md. Evidence aligns with tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Unclear claim blocks experiments. Claim drift breaks ../governance/core.md. Missing evidence breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Claim updates follow ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when claim is replaced. The replacement is architecture/metrics.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: formal_model
docs.text: Scope: Minimal formal model. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: State and constraint sets are explicit. Non-Goals: Full proofs. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines a minimal formal model. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. Vocabulary aligns with ../concepts/core_concepts.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: State space S is the set of agent states. Action space A is the set of signals. Transition function T maps (S, A) to S. Constraint set C limits valid transitions. Constraints align with architecture/invariants.md. Validation uses tests/unit/test_protein_system_rigidity.py.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: S, A, T, and C remain consistent. Definitions align with ../governance/core.md. Evidence aligns with tests/unit/test_protein_system_rigidity.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Ambiguous symbols break reviewability. Drift in definitions breaks ../governance/core.md. Unlinked references break ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Model updates follow ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when a formal spec exists. The replacement is architecture/architecture.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_protein_system_rigidity.py.

docs.title: neutral_results
docs.text: Scope: Negative and neutral results. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Limits are documented. Non-Goals: Full benchmark report. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc records neutral and negative results. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. Claim context lives in falsifiable_claim.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Regulator proposals can reduce recovery under strict constraints. Agenticity adds no benefit in low-noise pathways. Deterministic baselines win in short runs. Evidence uses tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Reported negatives remain visible. Results align with ../governance/core.md. Evidence aligns with tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing negatives reduces credibility. Result drift breaks ../governance/core.md. Missing evidence breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Result updates follow ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when results are automated. The replacement is architecture/metrics.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/regression/test_negative_results.py.

docs.title: reviewer_premortem
docs.text: Scope: Reviewer pre-mortem. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Anticipated critiques are explicit. Non-Goals: Debate. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc lists common review critiques. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. Claim context lives in falsifiable_claim.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Critique: “This is orchestration.” Response: signal scopes and pathway contracts show locality. Critique: “No intelligence.” Response: regulator proposals are bounded and measured. Critique: “Biology metaphor.” Response: constrained agents and pathways are explicit. Critique: “Over-engineered.” Response: invariants and failures are enforced. Evidence uses tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Critique list stays visible. Responses align with ../governance/core.md. Evidence aligns with tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing critiques weakens review readiness. Response drift breaks ../governance/core.md. Missing evidence breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Updates follow ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when critiques are encoded. The replacement is architecture/metrics.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/regression/test_architecture_invariants.py.

docs.title: system_schematic
docs.text: Scope: One-page system schematic. Audience: Reviewers and contributors. Guarantees: Components and boundaries are explicit. Non-Goals: Full architecture narrative. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc provides a single schematic. Architecture context lives in architecture/architecture.md. Vocabulary aligns with ../concepts/core_concepts.md.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Agents exchange signals within pathway edges. Constraints gate transitions and outputs. Regulator proposals remain bounded. Evidence uses tests/unit/test_protein_system_rigidity.py.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Schematic elements stay aligned with ../governance/core.md. Boundaries align with architecture/llm_authority.md. Evidence aligns with tests/unit/test_protein_system_rigidity.py.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Missing boundary labels weakens reviewability. Diagram drift breaks ../governance/core.md. Missing evidence breaks ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Schematic updates follow ../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Extensions align with architecture/experimental.md. Evidence updates align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc is obsolete when diagrams are generated. The replacement is architecture/architecture.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_protein_system_rigidity.py. 

flowchart LR
  AgentA -->|signal| AgentB
  AgentB -->|signal| AgentC
  Regulator -.->|proposal| AgentA
  Constraints --> AgentA
  Constraints --> AgentB
  Failure --> AgentC

docs.title: citation
docs.text: Scope: Citation metadata and release citation artifacts. Audience: Contributors and release operators. Guarantees: CITATION.cff matches the release version and repository URL. Non-Goals: Reference manager tutorials. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines the citation surface for releases. Canonical metadata lives in CITATION.cff. Citation artifacts are generated via makefiles/citation.mk.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Each statement is a contract. Contracts align with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py. Contracts link to threat_model.md and dependencies.md. - CITATION.cff is the canonical source of citation metadata. - make citation validates CFF and produces the other formats. - Release tags align with CITATION.cff version values.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Invariants describe stable behavior. Checks align with scripts/check_changelog_version.py. Invariants align with dependencies.md. - Citation metadata uses the repository URL and SPDX license. - Authors list includes the canonical ORCID record. - Citation artifacts stay in sync with CITATION.cff.

docs.title: Failure Modes
docs.text: Failures are explicit and tested. Failure coverage aligns with tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py. Failures align with ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. - Release metadata drift triggers a CI failure. - Missing citation files block release publishing. - Invalid CFF schema fails validation.

docs.title: Extension Points
docs.text: Extensions require tests and docs. Extensions are tracked in dependencies.md. Extensions align with scripts/check_changelog_version.py. - New citation formats require updates to makefiles/citation.mk. - New metadata fields require CITATION.cff changes.

docs.title: Exit Criteria
docs.text:
This doc becomes obsolete when citation artifacts are generated elsewhere. The replacement is linked in ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_docs_contract.py.

docs.title: threat_model
docs.text: Scope: Threat model skeleton. Audience: Contributors. Guarantees: Captures abuse cases, resource risks, and assumptions. Non-Goals: Mitigations. Why: This doc exists to record its single responsibility for review.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This doc defines one responsibility. Architecture components are defined in ../architecture/architecture.md. Read dependencies.md before edits. Read ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md for context.

docs.title: Contracts
docs.text: Each statement is a contract. Contracts align with tests/unit/test_abuse_case_path_traversal.py. Contracts link to dependencies.md and ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md.

docs.title: Invariants
docs.text: Invariants describe stable behavior. Checks align with tests/unit/test_abuse_case_path_traversal.py. Invariants align with dependencies.md.

docs.title: Failure Modes

This doc becomes obsolete when the surface ends. The replacement is linked in ../../meta/DOCS_STYLE.md. Obsolete docs are removed.

Code refs: tests/unit/test_abuse_case_path_traversal.py. Threats: - Conceptual drift in core definitions. - LLM overreach beyond regulator bounds. - Performance regression under load. - Reviewer misinterpretation of claims. Abuse cases: - Path traversal via candidate IDs. - Crafted sequence inputs to bypass validation. - Unauthorized resume requests for stale runs. Resource risks: - Large batch runs exhaust disk. - Oversized sequences exhaust memory. - High-rate API requests saturate CPU. Assumptions: - Local filesystem permissions prevent cross-tenant access. - Providers return deterministic results for fixed inputs. - CI artifacts are not tampered with between steps.
